sentences.english: He dismisses the theory that Etna is from a Greek source meaning “I burn.”
sentences.chinese: 他否定了埃特納來源於希臘語“我在燃燒”的說法。

sentences.english: I know no more Spanish than I know Greek.
sentences.chinese: 我對西班牙語和希臘語同樣不懂。

sentences.english: After Greek, we would learn to read French.
sentences.chinese: 學完希臘語後，我們將學習法語。

sentences.english: This is a Greek word that simply means the successors.
sentences.chinese: 這是個希臘語，意思就是繼業者。

sentences.english: So they read their scripture in Greek.
sentences.chinese: 所以他們看希臘語聖經。

sentences.english: He had an excellent command of Latin and Greek through self-learning.
sentences.chinese: 通過自學，他已經很好地掌握了拉丁語和希臘語。

sentences.english: They all read it in Greek.
Botanically, they are members of the genus "Eranthis", Greek for spring flower.
sentences.chinese: 植物學上，它們是菟葵屬，希臘語指春天的花朵。

sentences.english: And the Greek canon also accepts 4 Maccabees.
sentences.chinese: 希臘語正典書目還有馬卡比四書。

sentences.english: So they were Greek speaking, maybe people of Greek descent.
sentences.chinese: 所以他們說希臘語，很多人還是希臘後裔。

sentences.english: It is much easier to read French than read Greek.
sentences.chinese: 學習法語比學希臘語容易多了。

sentences.english: The alliance of Biblical faith and Hellenic reason culminated in the Middle Ages.
sentences.chinese: 在中世紀聖經和希臘語相結合，達到頂峯。

sentences.english: He was determined to learn Greek well.
He took Greek in his first year at university.
sentences.chinese: 他在大學一年級時學了希臘語。

sentences.english: Amen is transliterated from Hebrew into both Greek and English.
sentences.chinese: 阿門是譯音，從希伯來語到兩臺希臘語和英語。

sentences.english: So Romans who ruled in the East were expected to speak Greek.
sentences.chinese: 所以統治東方的羅馬人要會說希臘語。

definition: radical of a compound word (in European language)
pun/play on words/a phrase with a double meaning
reading or phonetic value of a character
